results.title: Dealing with Alzheimer's Disease: a commonsense approach to communication
results.creator_credit: Karen Feldt, Ramsey Foundation and Terra Nova
results.brief_description: Alzheimer’s Disease often produces memory loss and gradual changes in abilities to think, plan and communicate. Family members who are caregivers are often frustrated by these losses. This video is designed to help caregivers by providing information about these losses, teaching verbal and non-verbal communication techniques, describing common behaviour changes and providing suggestions to prevent or reduce problem behaviours.

results.title: Deaf Culture (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Adult Hearing Centre for Deaf and Hearing Impaired Persons
results.brief_description: Hearing people ask: What is it? What does it mean? Can we really speak about Deaf culture? Steve Ripley knows the worlds of the hearing and the deaf. He has travelled widely and tells his experiences in vivid sign language. A voice interpreter and subtitles are provided for those not fluent in sign language.

results.title: Dax's Case
results.brief_description: This documentary raised vital questions about a patient’s right to choose whether to live or die, and about the role of the medical and legal profession. In 1973 Dax Cowart, a former air force pilot, was the victim of an explosion which left him blind, disfigured and suffering excruciating pain from severe burns. Despite persistent pleas to be allowed to die, Dax was kept alive. Now, leading a full life, he still maintains that he should have been allowed to die.

results.title: Darwin was right!
results.brief_description: Fun and games with the animals at the Goologul Gardens including seals, bears and monkeys. Focusses mainly on chimpanzees with footage of them at various “human” activities - playing drums, fiddling with a hand-cranked camera, bathing a baby etc.

results.title: Danger level
results.creator_credit: Warren J Mills, Ansvar Insurance and Christopher Productions
results.brief_description: Tests of the effects of alcohol consumption on driving performance carried out by the Univeristy of New South Wales at the Warwick Farm Motor Racing Circuit. Volunteers including leading professional drivers undertake tests of skill after dosage to various blood alcohol levels, showing how ability is impaired.

results.title: Dandy dust (E)
results.brief_description: This genre-defying, gender-bending, no-budget, experimental feature draws its inspiration from such diverse sources as cyberpunk, anime, splatter films, sci-fi, Hong Kong action flicks, feminist theory, and queer underground cinema. Dandy is a “cyborg techno-human of fluid gender” who participates in a series of surreal, fetishistic sexual encounters whilst travelling across time and space in a bizzare futuristic universe. Extreme, visceral and visually inventive, the film gleefully upturns conventional notions of narrative, sex, gender and family, in its irreverent exploration of the relationship between body and machine, and the interplay between violence, eroticism and ritual. Cast includes Tre Temperilli, Hans Schierl and Svar Simpson.

results.title: Dance trip
results.brief_description: Describes the immigration of Filipinos to Hawaii and their lives, history and accomplishments there; recounts Philippine-United States relationships through old film clips. Presents many Filipino folk dances as danced by the Bailes de Jose.

results.title: Czechia: the Czech Republic today - tourist regions
results.creator_credit: Czech Tourist Authority, Terra-Klub and Va Unisa
results.brief_description: This is a snapshot presentation of the Czech Republic as it is today to encourage tourism to this rather unique and historical part of Europe. It briefly covers Prague, Central, Western and Eastern Bohemia, Sumava (Bohemian forest), Krknose Giant Mountains, Vysocina (Bohemian-Moravian Highlands), Southern and Central Moravia, Northern Moravia and Silesia with a basic overview of each area’s tourist attractions and historical background. Beautifully photographed, the video includes images of Prague Castle where kings, emperors, and presidents have resided, historical buildings alongside modern buildings, many examples of Baroque architecture, fairy-tale castles and chateaux, rivers, dams and man-made lakes, forests and mountains and a range of activities including swimming, boating, cycling, hiking, skiing, snow-boarding, and cross-country skiing. Steeped in history, the Czech Republic manages to blend the romantic old with the exciting new - a most intriguing region to visit.

results.title: Cultured pearls
results.brief_description: The complete process of pearl culture. Women divers take oysters from the seabed, which are injected with tissue and kernels, and placed in wire baskets to mature in warm sea water in bays and inlets. A careful watch is kept on the temperature and conditions of the sea, and the oysters are moved in the water as necessary. The shells are cleaned once a year, until harvesting, when the pearls are removed, graded, inspected and made up for dealers.
